name: 李老师不是你老师
content: May 11, Beijing (Release). Yang Mingzhu, a 75-year-old petitioner from Wuchang District, Wuhan, Hubei, complained to the police that she had been detained in this black jail for 267 days.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
The cousin of the girl who died in the Nantong bus accident said that the girl died on the spot.
"The 120 (at the scene) took a look and walked away because they knew our child could not be saved"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: May 11, Nantong. Netizens said that a traffic light near Yuelong Road was broken again, and there was no traffic police at the scene.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In the early morning of May 12, the mother of Gu Zixi, the victim of the Nantong bus accident, shared the mourning flowers sent by Nantong citizens and netizens across the country today.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
A Nantong user who works in the funeral business posted a banner on Douyin that read "Give me back my daughter", but it seems that this banner was not displayed today.
Some netizens analyzed that in another widely circulated photo of the memorial scene today, the banner in Gu Zixi's mother's arms might be this banner.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
The mother of the victim posted a message questioning the government's cover-up, pointing out that there was no so-called rescue at all.
"No one cared about my child at all, his head was rotten, and a passerby took off his clothes to cover the child, giving the child the last dignity."
"If the platform blocks it again, I will go to Beijing to sue. The government is covering up the truth with one hand."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
A post-00s generation submitted photos of the June 4th Incident in 1989, which were collected by their parents, showing that the official news media in Beijing generally openly supported the students in the square who demanded democracy and freedom.
“During the 1989 democracy movement, thousands of journalists demanded press freedom. The official news media broke through censorship and reported as truthfully as possible, which was an important driving force for the student movement to become a national democracy movement.”

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
"Please do not overstep your authority"
May 2, Shandong Tai'an New Youth Music Festival
The police at the scene arrested a man wearing a dragon robe.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: At noon on May 12, the words "criminal of the century" and "big liar" were written on the Einstein statue in Huazhong University of Science and Technology in Wuhan.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On May 12, at Dejie Zhuangyuan Mansion in Lianhu District, Xi'an.
Because the original plastic track planned for the community was paved with green bricks by the developer, it was spontaneously demolished by the owners on the same day, attracting a large number of police to maintain stability, and some owners were arrested during the period.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: The mother of Gu Zixi, the girl who died in the Nantong bus accident, released a photo with her child.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On May 12, Gu Zixi's grandmother displayed a banner outside the funeral home that read "Give me back my daughter". She said, "She was dead, but he still said he tried to save her for four hours. He lied with his eyes open."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On May 12, citizens took photos of people guarding the scene of the Nantong bus accident all night.
Some local netizens said that flower shops were asked not to send flowers to the scene of the accident.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On May 12, as the scene was under control, Nantong citizens went to the funeral home in Tianfuyuan to mourn Gu Zixin. Many netizens also posted the flowers they ordered on social platforms.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/abWlVIqGdq

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On May 12, the Taoxi Lanyuan residential community in Suzhou was left unfinished, and the owners went to the sales office that day to defend their rights.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On May 12, due to the long-term corruption and food safety problems in the cafeteria of Nanjing Tian Jiabing Senior High School, the school recently banned parents from sending meals, which caused dissatisfaction among students.
